intro: Tritoma northiae, commonly known as the North Island tritoma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Tritoma northiae is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in the North Island region of New Zealand. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
